skill.name: skill-creator-agent
skill.description: Creates Claude Code skills where each skill is tied to a specialist agent optimized with evidence-based prompting techniques. Use this skill when users need to create reusable skills that leverage specialized agents for consistent high-quality performance. The skill ensures that each created skill spawns an appropriately crafted agent that communicates effectively with the parent Claude Code instance using best practices.
skill.summary: Creates Claude Code skills where each skill is tied to a specialist agent optimized with evidence-ba...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing architectural guidance and code examples for creating agent-based skills. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Creating specialized AI skills is complex and error-prone without proper guidance. This skill provides a systematic 8-step framework for building skills that spawn specialist agents with evidence-based prompting techniques and production-ready SDK implementations.
actual_capabilities: Design specialist agent system prompts with evidence-based prompting techniques
Create two-layer skill architecture separating triggering from execution
Define communication protocols between skill and agent layers
Implement SDK-powered agent spawning with lifecycle management
Coordinate multiple specialist agents for complex workflows
Package skills with GraphViz process diagrams for documentation
limitations: Requires Claude Agent SDK knowledge for SDK-powered implementations
Pure documentation skill does not execute code itself
Created skills require separate implementation and testing
Only supports TypeScript and Python SDK implementations

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Tools
use_cases.description: Build consistent, high-quality skills that enforce team standards across all developers

use_cases.title: Automate Complex Workflows
use_cases.description: Create skills that spawn specialist agents for multi-step deployment and monitoring tasks

use_cases.title: Build Production Agents
use_cases.description: Design specialist agents with deep domain expertise and robust error handling

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill called api-generator that spawns a specialist agent to generate REST API code from OpenAPI specifications. Include the SKILL.md documentation and a GraphViz process diagram.

prompt_templates.title: Add Multi-Agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Extend the api-generator skill to coordinate three specialist agents: one for analysis, one for code generation, and one for validation.

prompt_templates.title: SDK Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a complete TypeScript SDK implementation for the api-generator skill including custom tools and lifecycle hooks.

prompt_templates.title: Best Practices Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current skill design and suggest improvements based on the skill-creator-agent best practices for communication protocols and agent layer design.

output_examples.input: Create a documentation skill that spawns a specialist agent
output: Skill Layer: SKILL.md with trigger detection and context handoff
Agent Layer: Specialist agent with documentation methodology
Communication Protocol: Progress reporting and result formatting
Resources: Documentation templates and validation scripts

best_practices: Keep skill layer lightweight focusing on triggering and invocation, not execution logic
Make agent layer comprehensive with deep domain expertise and failure mode awareness
Test complete skill-agent integration with realistic use cases before deployment
anti_patterns: Putting detailed execution logic in the skill layer instead of the agent
Skipping communication protocol documentation leading to integration issues
Using skills for simple tasks where traditional prompt-based approaches suffice

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code and Claude. SDK implementations support TypeScript and Python.

faq.question: What are the complexity limits?
faq.answer: Best for multi-step workflows requiring consistent specialist expertise. Overkill for simple tasks.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing skills?
faq.answer: Use the communication protocol to pass context between skills. Define clear contracts for handoff.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a documentation skill. Created skills run in your environment with your configured permissions.

faq.question: What if the agent fails?
faq.answer: Design agents with error detection, recovery logic, and escalation criteria in the system prompt.

faq.question: How is this different from regular skills?
faq.answer: Agent-based skills spawn specialized AI agents with deep domain expertise instead of direct execution.
